text: The premiership of Mohammad Mosaddegh began when his first government was formed on 28 April 1951 and ended on 19 August 1953, when his second government was overthrown by the American–British backed coup d'état. During the time, the two cabinets of Mosaddegh took control except for a brief period between 16 and 21 July 1952, in which Ahmad Qavam was the Prime Minister, taking office due to resignation of Mosaddegh from premiership and deposed by Shah after five days of mass demonstrations. == First cabinet == == Second cabinet == == See also == * The nationalization of the Iran oil industry movement == References == Category:Cabinets established in 1951 Category:Cabinets disestablished in 1952 Category:Cabinets established in 1952 Category:Cabinets disestablished in 1953 Category:Cold War history of Iran Category:Pahlavi dynasty Category:Nationalism in Iran Category:National Front (Iran) Category:Cabinets of Iran
title: Governments of Mohammad Mosaddegh
